title: (x) Library Book Return - ARB-85 Poster Script {Mike F}
content: Found this nice sign... anybody recognize it? ![Library sign](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052557im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42733.jpg)
author: ayesone

comments.content:
someone had a photo of that same lettering on their site.   
Was it Corey?   
   
 [www.coreyholms.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052557/http:/www.coreyholms.com/)   
   
Anyway, I think it's just a fancy lettering job.   
If it was anywhere, it would be in a PhotoLettering   
or Sign Painter's catalog.

It appears to be based upon some Alf Becker lettering,   
judging from Letterhead Fonts' [Becker Poster Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052557/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/chuckdavis/posterscript.shtml).

Another version is The Fontry's [ARB-85 Poster Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052557/http:/www.signweb.com/fontdownload/fonts.html) -   
and it's free! (there are two other Alf Becker digitizations   
offered for free from here as well).   
   
Edit: Hey, the [ARB-85 Poster Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052557/http:/www.thefontry.com/scriptpak1) that The Fontry offers   
for free download directly from its own website (see the   
links just above the 2nd graphic) differs from the one   
above and is, in fact, precisely the same as the lettering   
on the sign.

Hmm ... no ID credit for finding this font, Yves?   
   
Methinks the font in my Edit above matches the   
posted image exactly. I nail so few (he whined)!
So, just to cheer you up, this ID was pretty impressing, Mike.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052557im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
